area_name: South-Facing Wall (AKA the North Wall), The

content.description: This route begins in a broken corner system, then heads right up an intermittent seam that is a continuation of the initial corner system.  There are several cruxes between sections of easier rock and there are lots of rests.
content.location: This route is located on the wall right across from all of the 5.9's.  This is the same side of the canyon as the sacred trust wall.  From the sacred trust wall walk south to the arete at the end of the canyon then turn to the east and walk up the canyon.  This is the last route on the wall.  The first three bolts are shared with another 5.10 that branches off left (Interlopers).

content.description: Climb OK rock to the 2nd bolt... Don't blow the 2nd bolt(due to hollow sounding rock I placed the bolt in the best sounding rock) please stick clip second bolt if worried. After that it's fun face climbing with a short finger crack section to the chains!
content.protection: 9 Jimmy Jangles - 2 bolt ring (will install mussy hooks soon)

content.description: Amazing climbing on the craziest texture. The upper section of this has rock texture that will make you feel like Spider-Man. Without saying too much it felt like a crux down low and up high.  There was a second pitch we saw but didn't give a go.
content.location: On the wall opposite of the one with all the 5.9s. The wall this climb is on stays in the sun for a longer time than the rest. Literally climb through a tree (awesome). The first bolt is 7 ft off the ground and there is a tree next to it.

content.description: Moderate climbing leads to side pulls and pinches with a crux before the anchors.
content.location: Second route from left in main section

content.description: This is steep face climbing that moves to a bulge in the rock that contains the crux of the climb. Some of the rocks around this bulge maybe lose so be careful and make sure belayer is wearing a helmet. Once over the bulge, the climb is sustained for the last 2 bolts until you reach the anchors.
content.location: The route is on the eastern edge of the south-facing wall. You will see the routes on the southern wall as you walk towards Redbud Canyon Area.

content.description: This route begins in a broken corner system, then leaves the corner at the third bolt to continue up the perfect limestone face.  This route is quite continuous and doesn't really have any distinct crux.  Lots of fun technical moves for a full 100 feet.
content.location: This route is located on the wall right across from all the 5.9's.  This is the same side of the canyon as the sacred trust wall. From the sacred trust wall walk south to the arete at the end of the canyon then turn to the east and walk up the canyon. This is the second to last route on the wall. The first three bolts are shared with another route that branches off right (The Tyranny of Logic).

content.description: Starts up through chert bands right of a groove transitioning through a thinner section to blocky climbing above.
content.location: In a cluster of climbs downhill and left of The Tyranny of Logic/Interlopers, this is the third bolted line from the left.

content.description: This thin face climb has great hidden crimps with a strenuous overlap that is surmounted with underclings.

pathTokens: South-Facing Wall (AKA the North Wall), The

content.description: New area with fun routes but can be loose. Be aware of falling rock while climbing.
